com.robix.nexway
Interface Pod

public interface Pod

Interface for pods (aka robots, organs, ...).

getDefaultPodEventGen

public PodEventGen getDefaultPodEventGen()
Returns the Pod's default Pod Event Generator.

The default Pod Event Generator for a Pod is based on a PodShoppingList which subscribes to all Pod data.

Returns:
the Pod's default Pod Event Generator.

getPropertyHeartbeatTick

public int getPropertyHeartbeatTick()
Returns the Pod's 'property heartbeat' tick. This number is incremented every time a property heartbeat is received, even if the heartbeat does not contain any new data. Property heartbeats carry servo data, digout data, and the Pod's 'pause' state.

Returns:
the Pod's property heartbeat tick
See Also:
Usbor.getPropertyHeartbeatInterval()

getSensorHeartbeatTick

public int getSensorHeartbeatTick()
Returns the Pod's 'sensor heartbeat' tick. This number is incremented every time a sensor heartbeat is received, even if the heartbeat does not contain any new data. Sensor heartbeats carry only sensor data.

Returns:
the Pod's sensor heartbeat tick
See Also:
Usbor.getSensorHeartbeatInterval()

getAction

public int getAction()
Returns the Pod's current action.

Returns:
the Pod's current action.
See Also:
PodAction

isPaused

public boolean isPaused()
Determines if the Pod is currently in the 'paused' state.

Returns:
boolean true if Pod is paused; false otherwise

getScriptingMod

public int getScriptingMod()
Returns the modification number for the Pod's scripting information. This number is incremented every time there is a change to the Pod's scripting information.

This function is typically used to determine if any aspect of the Pod's scripting informatin has changed.

Returns:
the scripting mod

getScriptingInfo

public ScriptingInfo getScriptingInfo()
Returns a snapshot of the Pod's current scripting information.

Returns:
the Pod's current scripting information

getScriptingInfo

public ScriptingInfo getScriptingInfo(ScriptingInfo scriptInfo)
Refreshes a ScriptingInfo object with a snapshot of Pod's current scripting information. If scriptInfo is null, a new ScriptingInfo object is created and returned.

Parameters:
scriptInfo - the object to receive current scripting info; may be null
Returns:
the Pod's current scripting information
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if scriptInfo is not updatable

public void powerAllServos(boolean powerOn)
                    throws RbxGhostException
Sets power for all of a Pod's servos.

Parameters:
powerOn - true - power servos on; false - power servos off
Throws:
RbxGhostException - if Pod has become a ghost

runQuickScript

public int runQuickScript(java.lang.String scriptText)
                   throws RbxGhostException
Executes the specified quick script (aka immediate script).

Quick scripts are intended to be small and short-lived.

Parameters:
scriptText - the script to execute
Returns:
the sequence number (aka tracking number) associated with this Pod command
Throws:
RbxGhostException - if Pod has become a ghost
See Also:
isPodCmdStarted(int), isPodCmdFinished(int)

runQuickScript

public int runQuickScript(java.lang.String scriptText,
                          java.lang.String scriptName)
                   throws RbxGhostException
Executes the specified quick script (aka immediate script). This method allows a name to be associated with the script.

Quick scripts are intended to be small and short-lived.

Parameters:
scriptText - the script to execute
scriptName - the script's name
Returns:
the sequence number (aka tracking number) associated with this Pod command
Throws:
RbxGhostException - if Pod has become a ghost
See Also:
isPodCmdStarted(int), isPodCmdFinished(int)

assignMainScript

public int assignMainScript(java.lang.String scriptText,
                            java.lang.String scriptName)
                     throws RbxGhostException
Assigns the specified script to the pod. Assigning main scripts, and then running macros or lines is the preferred strategy for large, long-lived scripts.

Parameters:
scriptText - the script to assign
scriptName - the script's name
Returns:
the sequence number (aka tracking number) associated with this Pod command
Throws:
RbxGhostException - if Pod has become a ghost
See Also:
isPodCmdStarted(int), isPodCmdFinished(int)

assignMainScriptFromFile

public int assignMainScriptFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                    java.io.IOException,
                                    RbxGhostException
Reads a pod script from the specified file and assigns the script to the pod.

Parameters:
fileName - pod script filename
Returns:
the sequence number (aka tracking number) associated with this Pod command
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist or cannot be opened for reading
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
RbxGhostException - if Pod has become a ghost
See Also:
isPodCmdStarted(int), isPodCmdFinished(int)

runMainLines

public int runMainLines(int startLine,
                        int endLine)
                 throws RbxGhostException
Executes a set of lines in the pod's currently-assigned main script. All lines between, and including, startLine and endLine will be executed. Newline characters ('\n') in the script are used as line separators.

Parameters:
startLine - the first line to execute
endLine - the last line to execute
Returns:
the sequence number (aka tracking number) associated with this Pod command
Throws:
RbxGhostException - if Pod has become a ghost
See Also:
isPodCmdStarted(int), isPodCmdFinished(int)

runMainMacro

public int runMainMacro(java.lang.String macroName,
                        int iterations)
                 throws RbxGhostException
Executes the specified macro in the pod's currently-assigned main script.

Parameters:
macroName - the macro's name
iterations - the number of times to execute the macro; 0 for infinite
Returns:
the sequence number (aka tracking number) associated with this Pod command
Throws:
RbxGhostException - if Pod has become a ghost
See Also:
isPodCmdStarted(int), isPodCmdFinished(int)

runTeachCommand

public void runTeachCommand(java.lang.String teachCommand)
                     throws RbxGhostException
Executes a one-line script command. This method is intended for use by "user teach mode" type applications. General use of this method is strongly discouraged.

Parameters:
teachCommand - the command to execute
Throws:
RbxGhostException - if Pod has become a ghost

isPodCmdStarted

public boolean isPodCmdStarted(int seq)
Determines if the Pod command with the specified sequence number has started executing. This method is useful because Pod commands (assigning main scripts, running quick scripts, etc.) may not execute immediately. They are sent to a remote Nexus where they may be queued before execution.

Parameters:
seq - the sequence number (aka tracking number) to test
Returns:
true if the Pod command has started; false otherwise

isPodCmdFinished

public boolean isPodCmdFinished(int seq)
Determines if the Pod command with the specified sequence number has finished executing.

Parameters:
seq - the sequence number (aka tracking number) to test
Returns:
true if the Pod command has finished; false otherwise

isGhost

public boolean isGhost()
Determines if the Pod is a ghost.

A Pod may become disconnected from its peer object in a Nexus. This could happen, for example, if the device is unplugged, the Nexus is shut down, or the Nexus connection is lost (network problems). In such a case, the Pod dies and becomes a "ghost".

A ghost Pod has the following properties:

  • It receives no new data from its Nexus-based peer object.
  • getXxx() methods still work, but the data will be stale and will no longer be updated.
  • Pod control methods, such as runQuickScript(), stopScript(), etc., will throw an exception.
  • The Pod object will never come back to life. If the pod becomes accessible again later (e.g. the device is plugged back in), a new Pod object will be created.

    • Returns:
    true if the Pod has become a ghost; false otherwise
